Field Detail

OM_PREFIX

public static final java.lang.String OM_PREFIX
Prefix used for items that aren't values nor actions.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VALUE_PREFIX

public static final java.lang.String VALUE_PREFIX
Prefix used on item form names for items that represent values that should be updated in components. (Most forms return many values.) Items using this prefix are automatically passed to the component with ID that follows; if a single item uses multiple values it should use a different prefix (e.g. plain old OM_PREFIX).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ACTION_PREFIX

public static final java.lang.String ACTION_PREFIX
Prefix used on item form names for items that represent actions that should be taken. (Most forms return only one action.)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ID_PREFIX

public static final java.lang.String ID_PREFIX
Token to be placed before all XHTML IDs.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

buildInside

public void buildInside(QComponent qcParent,
                        org.w3c.dom.Element eParent)
                 throws OmException
Adds all components within the parent tag to the list of children. Does not include text nodes.

Parameters:
qcParent - Parent component that will own newly-created children
eParent - Parent XML element
Throws:
OmException - Any errors creating components

                              org.w3c.dom.Element eParent,

                       throws OmException

Throws:

build

public QComponent build(QComponent qcParent,
                        org.w3c.dom.Element e,
                        java.lang.String sTagName)
                 throws OmException
Builds component for the given element (which should also build any children)

Parameters:
qcParent - the parent component.
e - Element the element in question.xml that corresponds to this component.
sTagName - Must be null if the element belongs to the component being created; set it to override the component name if the component is implicit (has no parent element)
Returns:
QComponent that was created
Throws:
OmException - Any errors creating component

find

public QComponent find(java.lang.String sID)
                throws OmDeveloperException
Searches the tree for the component with given ID.

Works for both user-set IDs and self-assigned ones (though question authors probably shouldn't rely on the latter).

This is efficient so call it lots if you want to; don't bother caching the result.

Parameters:
sID - Required ID
Returns:
the component found
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If the component does not exist

find

public <T extends QComponent> java.util.List<T> find(java.lang.Class<T> c)
Searches the tree for components of a given class. Returns an array of the components, in document order. You may cast the array to one of the specifed class.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of component to find.
Parameters:
c - Class to look for
Returns:
Array of components (zero-length if none)

render

public void render(Rendering r,
                   boolean bInit)
            throws OmException
Renders question components into output.

Parameters:
r - Output for rendering
bInit - True if this is the first call to components in question init
Throws:
OmException - If there's any problem

public void informRemoved(QComponent qc)
Informs document that a component (and any children it may have) has been removed.

Parameters:
qc - Removed component

getGroupIndex

public int getGroupIndex(java.lang.String sGroup)
Given a 'group' name, turns it into a number. The first group is assigned 0, second is assigned 1, etc.

Parameters:
sGroup - Group name
Returns:
Group index
